NA.Math.02: Required Math 223 covers differential and integral calculus of several variables.

NA.Compute.02: Required course in CSC 110 Introduction to Computer Programming, which covers problem solving strategies, or ISTA 130 Computational Thinking and Doing, which covers design and problem solving.
NA.Compute.03: Required introductory course on computer programming that uses a programming language
NA.Compute.04: Students are required to take course intro course in computer science, either CSC 110 Introduction to Computer Programming I or ISTA 130 Computational Thinking and Doing.  Both cover data structures.

NA.Statistics.01: Required course, MATH 363 Intro to Stats.

NA.Statistics.04: Required course is MATH 363 Intro to Stats
NA.Statistics.05: MATH/STAT 467 Introduction​ ​to​ ​Applied​ ​Linear​ ​Models will be required course.
NA.Statistics.06: MATH/STAT 464s, a required course, will cover simulations and Required course MATH/STAT 467 Introduction​ ​to​ ​Applied​ ​Linear​ ​Models covers experimental designs.

NA.Domain.01: Students have to choose a minor; they may also choose another major.
NA.Ethics.04: no. UA Executive Summary says that goal of new major is to be able to “Critically evaluate and extend statistical models drawn from current scientific literature.”  However, specific mention of junk science or pseudoscience is not made in course descriptions.
